notes:
[Centripetal Charge](item_4c59fa91-c687-4c6d-810d-ddb79288315a) and  [Charged Plating](item_b8ca58e7-6ae2-40ee-8618-fe2f32315295) have great synergy to get you to 20% Ability Power in round 1, along with  [Power Playbook](item_6d8803cf-baa7-46ee-af91-51e7f2301418). Use your ult at the earliest opportunity to secure the buffs from  [Charged Plating](item_b8ca58e7-6ae2-40ee-8618-fe2f32315295). If you play it well, you can often get ult in the first fight.

Try to focus on landing javelins on squishies to secure eliminations and proc  [Frenzy Amplifier](item_d4b0cfcb-14e9-4472-a688-680120217250), which will either allow you to keep rolling the squishy eliminations or run away from the enemy tank if you're low on resources. If you're playing into beams, use your superior range to your advantage and your speed to out-rotate the enemy tank. You should be able to farm loads of Stadium Cash in round 1, even into Zarya.

round_upgrades.notes: Great starting power for any Orisa build. Enables high AP in early rounds with [Charged Plating], and the ability cooldown reset greatly enhances survivability. Also allows buffs tied to Fortify to be applied much more often.
Allows us to get up to 20% ability power in round 1 after first ult. With the ult cost reduction from [Centripetal Charge], we may be able to charge ult in the first fight.
Focus on hitting squishies with the javelin to secure elims and proc this buff. Don't get sucked into the tank trade if you can help it.

notes:
The only must-pick here is [Enhanced Target Sensors](item_d2e9e06c-5315-4ddb-b86a-d0397bd4dbbd), or  [Refraction Tiles](item_16e4b34e-d8dd-4cbd-85dc-ff6370cca092) if you're up against Zarya.  [Multi-Tool](item_5ba8d94e-f2f3-44b7-8773-025fc6ed7c56) is nice if you can afford it, as cooldown reductions are more efficient for Fortify, but any AP buff you like and can afford will do, or  [Electro Lights](item_d4ac5963-81ea-41b8-bc26-71905fadf860) if you're prone to overheating.

I don't recommend going for any Epic (purple) items yet, even if you can afford one. None of the special bonuses are really crucial right now, and you'll get more total stat buffs by filling more slots with blue and green items.

round_upgrades.notes: Great starting power for any Orisa build. Enables high AP in early rounds with [Charged Plating], and the ability cooldown reset greatly enhances survivability. Also allows buffs tied to Fortify to be applied much more often.
Must-pick against Zarya. Probably not needed against Mei unless she is specifically building into primary fire strength.

I believe this applies to all damage, not just weapon damage. Even if it's just weapon damage, hitting a javelin will usually put the target beyond 12m and activate this buff. You can assassinate squishies from ridiculously far away with this item.

Might be worth taking with [Refraction Tiles]. Note that the cooldown of Javelin Spin starts when the ability _ends_, so this item becomes less valuable as you build more cooldown reduction/acceleration.
Sans buffs, Fortify lasts for 4s, with a 15.5s cooldown that begins on ability activation, leaving 11.5s between uses. So, the 10% cooldown reduction actually reduces the downtime by 13%!
I don't think I've ever actually taken this, but we build ult very quickly, and having team overhealth before getting [Ride With Me] could be pretty good.
If you can't afford all 3 greens, sell this one first, as its benefit is conditional, and we don't really need the bonus armor. It's mainly here to give us 2 cheap 10% AP buffs.

notes:
[Efi’s Theorem](item_609c4cb6-a232-4e08-a11f-5252d40382be) is a must-pick here, as it buffs the duration of team move speed and overhealth we get from [Ride with Me](item_40de0b02-ce4b-4a66-8d1c-a129af10caec). There is an argument for taking [Hollagram Helmet](item_0919f17b-1024-455f-8aa5-df24daa8a126) instead against Zarya, to nullify her ult, but I think the benefit of team speed and overhealth to get teammates safely away from her during the neutral is more valuable for now. (You should be able to afford it next round without sacrificing Efi's Theorem.)

[Multi-Tool](item_5ba8d94e-f2f3-44b7-8773-025fc6ed7c56) is really nice, because the effective cooldown reduction for Fortify is ~15%. But, you can take whatever other AP buff you like if you prefer a different secondary bonus.

If you have enough cash to afford more blue-tier items, sell greens to make space. In sell-priority order: [Charged Plating](item_b8ca58e7-6ae2-40ee-8618-fe2f32315295),  [Power Playbook](item_6d8803cf-baa7-46ee-af91-51e7f2301418),  [Frenzy Amplifier](item_d4b0cfcb-14e9-4472-a688-680120217250)

round_upgrades.notes: Great starting power for any Orisa build. Enables high AP in early rounds with [Charged Plating], and the ability cooldown reset greatly enhances survivability. Also allows buffs tied to Fortify to be applied much more often.
Turns Fortify into Commanding Shout, which is great for both pushing and kiting.

The Fortify cooldown begins on activation, so extending its duration also reduces the downtime between uses! This item also gets you 50% more out of every "while Fortify is active" buff. S-tier item, keep for the rest of the game.
If your team is _really_ getting wrecked by grav, you could take this over [Efi's Theorem], but I think the additional offensive power of speed and overhealth likely to win you more fights.

I believe this applies to all damage, not just weapon damage. Even if it's just weapon damage, hitting a javelin will usually put the target beyond 12m and activate this buff. You can assassinate squishies from ridiculously far away with this item.

With Efi's Theorem, Fortify duration increases from 4s to 6s. Multi-Tool reduces the on-activation cooldown from 15.5s to ~14s. Between these two items, the downtime between Fortify uses is reduced from 11.5s to 8s, a 30% reduction!
Second priority to sell for a higher-tier item.
First priority to sell to free up a slot for a higher-tier item.
Third priority to sell for a higher-tier item.
Could be good if the enemy has multiple ranged backliners for easy assassinations. Ashe and Ana are super-easy to hit from range with their scoped self-slows.

notes:
Replace [Multi-Tool](item_5ba8d94e-f2f3-44b7-8773-025fc6ed7c56) with [Iridescent Iris](item_b7fb28ef-ce82-416b-8693-01c274f8df4e), unless you want and can afford both. The high AP buff will help us charge our low-cost ults even faster, and the overhealth plus the base Fortify overhealth plus the bonus [Ride with Me](item_40de0b02-ce4b-4a66-8d1c-a129af10caec) overhealth allows you to be pretty greedy with your HP and save yourself with ult. If they run through all that overhealth fast, you can trigger the slam to reset your cooldowns and use them to get out safely.

You may wish to choose a different purple item to solve/enhance a different gameplay aspect. Against Zarya, [Hollagram Helmet](item_0919f17b-1024-455f-8aa5-df24daa8a126) allows you to free your whole team from grav with Fortify, forcing her to bait out _both_ of your cooldowns in order to safely ult. And even if she does, you can use your own ult to trigger the effect. If your timing is good enough, you can also nullify Earthshatter or Junker Queen's Bow Down ult knockdown, but I personally struggle to time it right even when I know it's coming.

If you're able to safely javelin spin through enemies (i.e. the enemy tank isn't just going to destroy you if you try to trade with them), [Cybervenom](item_210a8582-91ec-4cf3-968a-a443f3a0c505) can help your team secure kills. If the enemy have several slower ranged heroes (e.g. Ashe, Ana) or tank with limited/no damage-blocking (e.g. Junker Queen),  [Superflexor](item_580b77b4-0d63-469b-99a8-5372c55dfc1b)'s modest WP buff can combo nicely with [Enhanced Target Sensors](item_d2e9e06c-5315-4ddb-b86a-d0397bd4dbbd) to get kills from range and stack up more AP from your weapon hits. [Liquid Nitrogen](item_a8d99526-05a3-4405-babb-b025479b1b98) can enhance the lethality of your ults, especially if the enemy is lacking in cleanses. The 25 health buffs from the latter two options are probably not going to help much though.

I've included [Electro Lights](item_d4ac5963-81ea-41b8-bc26-71905fadf860) here because rising enemy HP levels will raise the risk of overheating. You should be able to cover the overheat recovery pretty well with abilities, but it's nice to get it done faster. The attack speed is also very helpful for finishing squishies before they get away.

Take any other blue or green AP buffs you can afford to fill out slots.

round_upgrades.notes: Great starting power for any Orisa build. Enables high AP in early rounds with [Charged Plating], and the ability cooldown reset greatly enhances survivability. Also allows buffs tied to Fortify to be applied much more often.
Turns Fortify into Commanding Shout, which is great for both pushing and kiting.
Optional to fill out a slot if you have a little extra cash.
Optional to fill out a slot if you have a little extra cash.
To be replaced with Iridescent Iris, but you can take both if you can afford it.

Strong AP buff, cooldown reduction (which is extra-efficient for our extended Fortify), and an on-ult buff that we'll get to use often. Another S-tier item for this build! Keep for the rest of the game.
Go ahead and sell this if you can afford more blue items. I just really like being able to stack up more speed.

notes:
With [Efi’s Theorem](item_609c4cb6-a232-4e08-a11f-5252d40382be), the cooldown reduction during Fortify from [Factory Reset](item_d98df807-9dd6-4553-96bb-a1b49a0fe169) lasts for 6s, which is long enough to get Javelin Spin back again if it was used right before Fortify, and the javelin throw is reduced to 4.5s, all without considering other cooldown reductions. This is why taking a zillion self-heal survival items is a poor build strategy. By instead building to enhance our abilities, we still get oodles of personal survivability, while also greatly increasing our lethality and CC/disruption output, and supporting teammate survivability and aggression. By this point in an Orisa mirror match, the enemy Orisa will usually have 200-300 HP more than I do, and she may even be annoyingly difficult to kill even after her whole team is dead. But her whole team _will_ die while mine lives, unless we do something stupid or they massively out-ult us.

Anyway, I like [Mark of the Kitsune](item_09a53e39-25aa-4f66-ba51-bedbc543a1eb) here, but [Superflexor](item_580b77b4-0d63-469b-99a8-5372c55dfc1b) and  [Three-tap Tommygun](item_39c5d2a4-1db0-444f-86d9-2a1e9a331429) are good cheaper alteratives. If you want to replace the movement speed buff from [Frenzy Amplifier](item_d4b0cfcb-14e9-4472-a688-680120217250), you can take  [Booster Jets](item_a291de85-b6d9-43cf-b5da-f3184a156f48) or  [Aftermarket Firing Pin](item_2485b212-b286-42d0-a2bd-20eb4396b054). Fill slots with whatever other blue or green AP upgrades you can afford.

If you had [Elite Rotator Cuff](item_dfba3349-64b8-4386-8eaf-15bcd1ca6b37) to enhance [Refraction Tiles](item_16e4b34e-d8dd-4cbd-85dc-ff6370cca092) into Zarya, and you have the cash to get another purple upgrade instead, I recommend replacing it. The cooldown reduction in Fortify plus [Iridescent Iris](item_b7fb28ef-ce82-416b-8693-01c274f8df4e) gives you plenty of spin uptime already.

round_upgrades.notes: Great starting power for any Orisa build. Enables high AP in early rounds with [Charged Plating], and the ability cooldown reset greatly enhances survivability. Also allows buffs tied to Fortify to be applied much more often.
Turns Fortify into Commanding Shout, which is great for both pushing and kiting.
Cycling cooldowns faster gives us both more survivability and more kill potential. Efi's Theorem item extends the cooldown acceleration duration by 50%.
Keep if you don't have the cash to fill all your slots with purples and blues, or if you have enough for 4 purples and need to fill the last slot.
Replace with any other purple-tier AP buff item that you prefer or seems more contextually useful.
Take a different blue-tier buff here if you like. I personally don't think the other buffs are really needed at this point though, so I like to stack up the raw AP.

notes:
We have all of our highest-value items already, so it's your choice which further purple upgrades you want.  [Champion's Kit](item_8682f8c7-8811-439b-8d50-fa81cd43ddce) is great if you don't feel like you really need any additional utility. You can easily have 2-ult fights with that much AP.

If you can afford it, feel free to dump  [Electro Lights](item_d4ac5963-81ea-41b8-bc26-71905fadf860) in favor of something costlier. You'll be getting your abilities up fast enough that overheating won't be a big deal anyway. I generally keep [Enhanced Target Sensors](item_d2e9e06c-5315-4ddb-b86a-d0397bd4dbbd) until the bitter end, but you can trade it out if you want, especially on a more close-range map.

round_upgrades.notes: Great starting power for any Orisa build. Enables high AP in early rounds with [Charged Plating], and the ability cooldown reset greatly enhances survivability. Also allows buffs tied to Fortify to be applied much more often.
Turns Fortify into Commanding Shout, which is great for both pushing and kiting.
Cycling cooldowns faster gives us both more survivability and more kill potential. Efi's Theorem item extends the cooldown acceleration duration by 50%.
Replaces Nano Cola. Again, choose a different purple here if you prefer the secondary buff or just don't have enough cash.

notes:
The final power choice here is really up to preference and the specifics of the match.

I like [Supercharger](item_3b888b9f-1c3a-47ce-8326-41f2a312d66f) for even more damage, though it can be vulnerable to being insta-killed. (See note in the Powers section for more details on that.) In combination with [Centripetal Charge](item_4c59fa91-c687-4c6d-810d-ddb79288315a) and  [Iridescent Iris](item_b7fb28ef-ce82-416b-8693-01c274f8df4e), you do have the option to treat your ult as a Supercharger + overhealth + ability reset and actually prioritize bongo safety over the actual Terra Surge pull and damage with your positioning. With so much damage flying around in round 7, standing still in the middle of the enemy team can be pretty scary, even with the Fortify damage reduction, so it could be worthwhile trade.

There's also a good argument for  [Restortify](item_e5073fbb-8287-4d11-934a-1fc1c57a308b), which also benefits from  [Efi’s Theorem](item_609c4cb6-a232-4e08-a11f-5252d40382be). I don't love it because it offers nothing offensive, but it may be worthwhile into beams, or if the enemy team has just been trying really hard to kill you. The healing benefit is less for us than for the HP-stacking Orisas though, since it is percentage-based.

[Advanced Throwbotics](item_20ae3070-5e6b-4352-b024-95b426055ee0) could be good too, if having even more stun/knockback seems useful. Our cooldowns should be quite short at this point, and the enemy team might have enough damage that trying to actually damage them with Javelin Spin might be too dangerous much of the time. If you use Javelin Spin primarily for the bonus Energy Javelin, you can cancel the spin early to start the cooldown sooner and get even more bonus stuns.

Final items are by preference.

round_upgrades.notes: Great starting power for any Orisa build. Enables high AP in early rounds with [Charged Plating], and the ability cooldown reset greatly enhances survivability. Also allows buffs tied to Fortify to be applied much more often.
Turns Fortify into Commanding Shout, which is great for both pushing and kiting.
Cycling cooldowns faster gives us both more survivability and more kill potential. Efi's Theorem item extends the cooldown acceleration duration by 50%.

The Supercharger will drop right behind you, which can make it vulnerable to being insta-popped by AoE damage since you are pulling enemies on top of you as well (though you can just pop the ult for the reset). If you run and jump into ult, you can create a little space between you and the supercharger. You can also activate the ult immediately after jumping off of high ground, to deploy it right on the edge. You can also throw the ult like a DVa bomb with Oladele-Copter Blades.

The Fortify cooldown begins when Fortify _starts_, not when it _ends_, so extending its duration also reduces the downtime between uses! This item also gets you 50% more out of every "while Fortify is active" buff. S-tier item.
